speaker: ALADDIN
text: THE COMPLETE SCRIPT COMPILED BY BEN SCRIPPS <34RQNPQ@CMUVM.CSV.CMICH.EDU>

speaker: PEDDLER
text: Oh I come from a land From a faraway place Where the caravan camels roam Where they cut off your ear /Where it's flat and immense If they don't like your face /And the heat is intense It's barbaric, but hey--it's home! When the wind's at your back And the sun's from the west And the sand in the glass is right Come on down, Stop on by Hop a carpet and fly To another Arabian night!  Arabian nights Like Arabian days More often than not Are hotter than hot In a lot of good ways  Arabian nights 'Neath Arabian moons A fool off his guard Could fall and fall hard Out there on the dunes.  Ah, Salaam and good evening to you worthy friend. Please, please, come closer--(Camera zooms in hitting peddler in face) Too close, a little too close.  (Camera zooms back out to CU)There.Welcome to Agrabah.  City of mystery, of enchantment, and the finest merchandise this side of the river Jordan, on sale today, come on down! Heh, heh.  Look at this! Yes!  Combination hookah and coffee maker--also makes Julienne fries.  Will not break

speaker: JAFAR
text: You...are late.

speaker: GAZEEM
text: A thousand apologies, O patient one.

speaker: JAFAR
text: You have it, then?

speaker: GAZEEM
text: I had to slit a few throats to get it.  (Pulls out half of the medallion.  JAFAR reaches out for it, but GAZEEM yanks it back.)  Ah, ah, ahhh!  The treasure!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Trust me, my pungent friend.  You'll get what's coming to you.

speaker: IAGO
text: What's coming to you!  Awk!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Quickly, follow the trail!

speaker: JAFAR
text: At last, after all my years of searching,  the cave of wonders!

speaker: IAGO
text: Awk!  Cave of wonders!

speaker: GAZEEM
text: By Allah!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Now, remember!  Bring me the lamp.  The rest of the treasure is yours, but the lamp is mine!

speaker: IAGO
text: Awk, the lamp!  Awk,  the lamp!  (Now that IAGO and JAFAR are alone, IAGO opens up in normal English.) Jeez, where'd ya dig this bozo up?

speaker: CAVE
text: Who disturbs my slumber?

speaker: GAZEEM
text: It is I, Gazeem, a humble thief.

speaker: CAVE
text: Know this.  Only one may enter here.  One whose worth lies far within.  A diamond in the rough.

speaker: JAFAR
text: What are you waiting for?  Go on!

speaker: CAVE
text: Seek thee out, the diamond in the rough.

speaker: IAGO
text: I can't believe it.  I just don't believe it. We're never gonna get a hold of that stupid lamp!  Just forget it.  Look at this.  Look at this.  I'm so ticked off that I'm molting!  (He flies up to JAFAR's shoulder.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Patience, Iago.  Patience.  Gazeem was obviously less than worthy.

speaker: IAGO
text: (Extremely sarcastically) Oh, there's a big surprise.  That's an incred--I think I'm gonna have a heart attack and die from not surprise!  What're we gonna do?  We got a big problem here,a big prob-

speaker: JAFAR
text: Yes, we do.  Only one may enter.  I must find this one, this...diamond in the rough.

speaker: GUARD
text: Stop, thief!  I'll have your hands for a trophy, street rat!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Looks back, then down, then at the bread.)  All this for a loaf of bread?  GUARD 1:    There he is! GUARD 2:    You won't get away so easy!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: You think that was easy?  GUARD 1:    You two, over that way, and you, with me.  We'll find him.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Morning, ladies. WOMAN 1:    Getting into trouble a little early today, aren't we Aladdin?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Trouble?  No way.  You're only in trouble if you get caught--

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'm in trouble!

speaker: GUARD
text: ...and this time--(A screeching sound from ABU, then the guard's turban is pulled down over his eyes.  ABU dances on the GUARD's head, laughing.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Perfect timing, Abu!

speaker: ABU
text: Hello!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Come on, let's get outta here! Gotta keep...one jump ahead of the breadline One swing ahead of the sword I steal only what I can't afford That's everything!

speaker: GUARDS
text: (one at a time) Riffraff! Street rat! Scoundrel! Take that!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Just a little snack, guys!

speaker: GUARDS
text: Rip him open, take it back guys!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I can take a hint, gotta face the facts You're my only friend, Abu!

speaker: WOMEN
text: Who?!?

speaker: WOMAN
text: I'd blame parents, except he hasn't got 'em!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Gotta eat to live, gotta steal to eat Tell you all about it when I got the time!

speaker: CROWD
text: Stop, thief! Vandal! Outrage! Scandal!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Let's not be too hasty

speaker: LADY
text: Still I think he's rather tasty

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Gotta eat to live, gotta steal to eat Otherwise we'd get along!

speaker: GUARDS
text: WRONG!  GUARD 1:    He's got a sword! GUARD 2:    You idiot--we've ALL got swords!!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: One jump ahead of the hoofbeats!

speaker: CROWD
text: Vandal!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: One hop ahead of the hump!

speaker: CROWD
text: Street rat!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: One trick ahead of disaster

speaker: CROWD
text: Scoundrel!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: They're quick--but I'm much faster

speaker: CROWD
text: Take that!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Here goes, better throw my hand in Wish me happy landin' All I gotta do is jump!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: And now, esteemed effendi, we feast!  All right!

speaker: ABU
text: Uh-oh!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Here, go on--take it.

speaker: ABU
text: Ah, don't.  Huh?  BYSTANDER 1:    On his way to the palace, I suppose. BYSTANDER 2:    Another suitor for the princess.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Out of my way, you filthy brat!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey, if I were as rich as you, I could afford some manners

speaker: PRINCE
text: Oh--I teach you some manners!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Look at that, Abu.  It's not every day you see a horse with two rear ends!

speaker: PRINCE
text: You are a worthless street rat.  You were born a street rat, you'll die a street rat, and only your fleas will mourn you.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'm not worthless.  And I don't have fleas.  Come on, Abu.  Let's go home.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Riffraff, street rat. I don't buy that. If only they'd look closer Would they see a poor boy?  No siree. They'd find out, there's so much more to me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I've never been so insulted!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, Prince Achmed.  You're not leaving so soon, are you?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Good luck marrying her off!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, Jasmine!  Jasmine!  Jasmine!  (The SULTAN goes off into the garden looking for his daughter.  He finds her, but is interrupted by RAJAH, JASMINE's pet tiger, who blocks him off.  RAJAH has a piece of the PRINCE's undershorts in his mouth.The SULTAN grabs the cloth and yanks it out of RAJAH's mouth.) Confound it, Rajah!  So, this is why Prince Achmed stormed out!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, father.  Rajah was just playing with him, weren't you Rajah.  (RAJAH comes over and allows JASMINE to pet and hug him.)  You were just playing with that overdressed, self-absorbed Prince Achmed, weren't you?  (She cuddles with RAJAH, enjoying the moment, until she looks up at her angry father. ) Ahem.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Dearest, you've got to stop rejecting every suitor that comes to call.  The law says you...

speaker: BOTH
text: ...must be married to a prince.

speaker: SULTAN
text: By your next birthday.

speaker: JASMINE
text: The law is wrong.

speaker: SULTAN
text: You've only got three more days!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Father,  I hate being forced into this.  (She takes a dove out of the cage and pets it.) If I do marry, I want it to be for love.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jasmine, it's not only this law.  (She hands him the dove, and he puts it back in the cage.) I'm not going to be around forever, and I just want to make sure you're taken care of, provided for.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Try to understand.  I've never done a thing on my own. (She swirls her finger in the water of the pond, petting the fish.)I've never had any real friends. (RAJAH looks up at her and growls.) Except you, Rajah.  (Satisfied, he goes back to sleep.)  I've never even been outside the palace walls.

speaker: SULTAN
text: But Jasmine, you're a princess.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Then maybe I don't want to be a princess.  (She splashes the water.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oooohhh!  Allah forbid you should have any daughters!

speaker: SULTAN
text: I don't know where she gets it from.  Her mother wasn't nearly so picky.  (A shadow falls over him. He looks up startled and sees JAFAR.)  Ooh, oh. Ah, Jafar--my most trusted advisor.  I am in desperate need of your wisdom.

speaker: JAFAR
text: My life is but to serve you, my lord.  (He bows.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: It's this suitor business.  Jasmine refuses to choose a husband.  I'm at my wit's-end.

speaker: IAGO
text: (In the parrot voice) Awk!  Wit's-end.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, ha ha.  Have a cracker, pretty polly!  (He pulls a cracker out from his pocket.  IAGO looks terrified.  Then the SULTAN stuffs it in IAGO's mouth.  IAGO grimaces as he tries to eat it.  JAFAR and the SULTAN both laugh.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Your majesty certainly has a way with dumb animals.

speaker: SULTAN
text: If anyone can help, it's you.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Ah, but it would require the use of the mystic blue diamond.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Uh, my ring?  But it's been in the family for years.

speaker: JAFAR
text: It is necessary to find the princess a suitor.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Everything...will be...fine.

speaker: JAFAR
text: The diamond.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Here, Jafar. Whatever you need will be fine.

speaker: JAFAR
text: You are most gracious, my liege.  Now run along and play with your little toys.

speaker: SULTAN
text: (Still hypnotized)  Yes...that'll be...pretty good.

speaker: IAGO
text: I can't take it anymore!  If I gotta choke down on one more of those moldy, disgusting crackers...bam! Whack!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Calm yourself, Iago.

speaker: IAGO
text: Then I'd grab him around the head.  Whack! Whack!

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Speaking over IAGO.)  Soon, I will be sultan, not that addlepated twit.

speaker: IAGO
text: And then I stuff the crackers down his throat!  Ha ha!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Rajah.  But I can't stay here and have my life lived for me.  I'll miss you.(She begins to climb again, and is helped up by RAJAH, who begins to whine and whimper.)  Good bye!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Okay, Abu.  Go!

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: (To passing crowd)  Try this, your taste buds will dance and sing. (ABU grabs a melon and hangs there, distracting his attention.)  Hey, get your paws off that.

speaker: ABU
text: Blah blah blah!

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: Why, you!  Get away from here, you filthy ape!

speaker: ABU
text: Bye bye!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Nice goin' Abu.  Breakfast is served.  SHOPKEEPER 1:   Pretty lady, buy a pot.  No finer pot in brass or silver. SHOPKEEPER 2:   Sugar dates, sugar dates and figs!  Sugar dates and pistachios! SHOPKEEPER 3:   Would the lady like a necklace.  A pretty necklace for a pretty lady.  SHOPKEEPER 4:   Fresh fish!  We catch 'em, you buy 'em!

speaker: JASMINE
text: I don't think so.  (She backs away, but bumps into a fire eater, who is startled into swallowing his fire.)  Oh, excuse me.  (He gulps, then belches fire from his mouth.  JASMINE is disgusted.  He is pleased and taps his stomach.  ALADDIN sees her, and a strange look comes over his face.)  I'm really very sorry.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (He's obviously deeply in love with her.)  Wow!

speaker: ABU
text: Uh oh.  Hello?  Hello?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, you must be hungry.  Here you go.  (The boy runs off.)

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: You'd better be able to pay for that.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (Mystified) Pay?

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: No one steals from my cart!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, I'm sorry sir.  I don't have any money.

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: Thief!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Please, if you let me go to the palace, I can get some from the Sultan.

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: Do you know what the penalty is for stealing?

speaker: JASMINE
text: No, no please!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Thank you kind sir.  I'm so glad you've found her. I've been looking all over for you.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (whispering) What are you doing?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (whispering back) Just play along.

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: You know this girl?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Sadly, yes.  She is my sister.  She's a little crazy.  (He circles his finger around his ear. She is shocked.  The PROPRIETOR grabs him by the vest.)

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: She said she knows the Sultan!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: She thinks the monkey is the Sultan.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, wise Sultan.  How may I serve you?

speaker: ABU
text: Well, blah blah blah blah.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Tragic, isn't it?  (He leans forward, picking up another apple from the cart with his foot.) But, no harm done.  (Walks over to Jasmine.)  Now come along sis. Time to see the doctor.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (To a camel standing nearby) Oh, hello doctor. How are you?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No, no, no. Not that one. (To ABU, whose pockets are bulging.) Come on, Sultan.

speaker: PROPRIETOR
text: Huh?  What is it?  (ABU picks up what he can carry, and the trio run off.) Come back here, you little thieves!

speaker: IAGO
text: (huffing and puffing)  With all due respect, your rottenness, couldn't we just wait for a real storm?

speaker: JAFAR
text: Save your breath, Iago.  Faster!  (He places the SULTAN's ring in the contraption.)

speaker: IAGO
text: Yes, o mighty evil one.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Ah, sands of time--reveal to me the one who can enter the cave.  (The sand in top forms the Cave of Wonders.  It falls through into a storm, but it shows ALADDIN climbing up a ladder, followed by JASMINE who is covered in her cloak.) Yes, yes! There he is.  My diamond in the rough!

speaker: IAGO
text: That's him?!?!   That's the clown we've been waitin' for? (IAGO loses his footing and is sucked into the gears.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Let's have the guards extend him an invitation to the palace, shall we?

speaker: IAGO
text: Swell.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Almost there.

speaker: JASMINE
text: I want to thank you for stopping that man.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Uh, forget it.  (He grabs a pole.)  So, uh, this is your first time in the marketplace, huh?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Is it that obvious?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, you do kinda stand out.  (He stares at her, still in love.  She returns the look.  But he realizes what he is doing, and returns to normal.) I mean, uh, you don't seem to know how dangerous Agrabah can be. (He lays a plank between the buildings for her to walk over, but as he is leaned down, she vaults over his head.  He looks back in surprise.  She tosses the pole to him.  Both ALADDIN's and ABU's eyes bulge.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: I'm a fast learner.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Right.  C'mon, this way.  (They go inside the roof of a building, dodging planks and beams as they go.)  Whoa.  Watch your head there.  Be careful.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Is this where you live?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yep.  Just me and Abu.  Come and go as we please.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Fabulous.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, it's not much, (he pulls back the curtain and exposes the palace) but it's got a great view. Palace looks pretty amazing, huh?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, it's wonderful.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I wonder what it would be like to live there, to have servants and valets...

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, sure.   People who tell you where to go and how to dress.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: It's better than here.  Always scraping for food and ducking the guards.

speaker: JASMINE
text: You're not free to make your own choices.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Sometimes you feel so--

speaker: JASMINE
text: You're just--

speaker: BOTH
text: (in unison) --trapped.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: So, where're you from?

speaker: JASMINE
text: What does it matter?  I ran away, and I am not going back.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Really?  (He takes a bite from the apple in his hand, then hands it to ABU, who has a disgusted look on his face.)

speaker: ABU
text: Why you!

speaker: JASMINE
text: My father's forcing me to get married.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: That's--that's awful.  (ABU appears from behind the princess and tries to steal the apple.) Abu!

speaker: JASMINE
text: What?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu says that--uh--that's not fair.

speaker: ABU
text: What?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh did he?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yeah, of course.

speaker: JASMINE
text: And does Abu have anything else to say?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, uh, he wishes there was something he could do to help.

speaker: ABU
text: Oh, boy!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Hmm, tell him that's very sweet.

speaker: GUARD
text: Here you are! ALADDIN and JASMINE:    They've found me!  (To each other) They're after you?

speaker: JASMINE
text: My father must have sent them--

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Do you trust me?

speaker: JASMINE
text: What?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Do you trust me? (He extends his hand)

speaker: JASMINE
text: Yes. (She takes it.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Then jump!

speaker: GUARD
text: We just keep running into each other, don't we, street rat?

speaker: GUARD
text: It's the dungeon for you, boy.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey, get off of me!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Let go of him.

speaker: GUARD
text: (Not realizing she is the princess) Look what we have here, men--a street mouse.  (He throws her down.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: (standing up and pulling off the hood of her cloak) Unhand him, by order of the princess.

speaker: GUARD
text: Princess Jasmine.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: The princess?

speaker: ABU
text: (peeking out from the vase) The princess?

speaker: GUARD
text: What are you doing outside the palace?  And with this street rat?

speaker: JASMINE
text: That's not your concern.  Do as I command.  Release him!

speaker: GUARD
text: Well, I would, princess, but my orders come from Jafar.  You'll have to take it up with him.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (getting a very pissed-off look) Believe me, I will.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Jafar?

speaker: JAFAR
text: Oh, uh, princess.

speaker: IAGO
text: Awk! Jafar, I'm stuck!

speaker: JAFAR
text: How may I be of service to you? (He spreads out his cape, hiding the door.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: The guards just took a boy from the market, on your orders.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Your father's charged me with keeping peace in Agrabah.  The boy was a criminal.

speaker: JASMINE
text: What was the crime?

speaker: IAGO
text: I can't breathe, Jafar!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Why, kidnapping the princess, of course.

speaker: IAGO
text: If you could just--(JAFAR kicks him back inside the door and it slams shut)--wow, that hurt!

speaker: JASMINE
text: He didn't kidnap me! I ran away!

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Walking away as if shocked) Oh, dear!  Oh, why frightfully upsetting.  Had I but known.

speaker: JASMINE
text: What do you mean?

speaker: JAFAR
text: Sadly, the boy's sentence has already been carried out.

speaker: JASMINE
text: What sentence?

speaker: JAFAR
text: (with a sinister tone)  Death.  (JASMINE gasps.) By beheading.

speaker: JASMINE
text: No!  (She collapses to the floor.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: I am exceedingly sorry, princess.

speaker: JASMINE
text: How could you?  (She runs from the room crying.)

speaker: IAGO
text: So, how did  it go?

speaker: JAFAR
text: I think she took it rather well.  (They both get a sinister smile on their faces.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: It's all my fault, Rajah.  I didn't even know his name.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (to himself) She was the princess.  I don't believe it.  I must have sounded so stupid to her.

speaker: ABU
text: (from a distance) Yoo-hoo!  Aladdin? Hello!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu!  Down here!  Hey, c'mon--help me outta these.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey, she was in trouble.  Ah, she was worth it.

speaker: ABU
text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Don't worry, Abu.  I'll never see her again.  I'm a street rat, remember, and there's a law. She's gotta marry a prince, she deserves it.

speaker: ABU
text: Ta da!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Rubbing his wrists) I'm a--I'm a fool OLD MAN:    You're only a fool if you give up, boy.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Who are you? OLD MAN:    A lowly prisoner, like yourself.  But together, perhaps we can be more.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'm listening. OLD MAN:    There is a cave, boy.  A cave of wonders.  Filled with treasures beyond your wildest dreams. Treasure enough to impress even your princess, I'd wager.

speaker: IAGO
text: Jafar, can ya hurry it up?  I'm dyin' in here!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: But the law says that only a prince can marry-- OLD MAN:    You've heard of the golden rule, haven't you boy? Whoever has the gold makes the rules.(He grins, showing a hideously bad mouth.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: So why would you share all of this wonderful treasure with me? OLD MAN:    I need a young man with strong legs and a strong back to go in after it.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Ah, one problem.  It's out there, we're in here?  OLD MAN:    Mmm, mmm, mmm.,  Things aren't always what they seem.  So, do we have a deal?

speaker: ABU
text: Oh, hmm.

speaker: CAVE
text: Who disturbs my slumber?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: It is I, Aladdin.

speaker: CAVE
text: Proceed.  Touch nothing but the lamp.  OLD MAN:    Remember, boy--first fetch me the lamp, and then you shall have your reward.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: C'mon, Abu.  (to ABU hiding under the shoulder of his vest.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Would ya look at that!

speaker: ABU
text: Uh oh!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Just a handful of this stuff would make me richer than the sultan!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Don't...touch...anything!  We gotta find that lamp.

speaker: ABU
text: Huh?

speaker: ABU
text: Aladdin!  Aladdin!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu, will ya knock it off?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu, what are you--crazy?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: A magic carpet!  C'mon.  C'mon out.  I'm not gonna hurt you.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Take it easy, Abu.  He's not gonna bite.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey, wait a minute.  Don't go.  Maybe you can help us.  (CARPET looks back, excited. It then flies over and wraps around the pair.)  Hey, whoa!  You see, we're trying to find this lamp.  (CARPET motions for them to follow it.)  I think he knows where it is.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Wait here!

speaker: ABU
text: Oh.  Huh?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: This is it?  This is what we came all the way down here to--  (He looks down and sees ABU break free of CARPET's hold and lunge toward the jewel.)  Abu- NO!  CAVE VOICE: Infidels!

speaker: ABU
text: Uh oh! CAVE VOICE: You have touched the forbidden treasure.  (ABU places the jewel back into the paw, but the jewel and the shrine melt into lava.) Now you will never again see the light of day!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Whoa!  Carpet, let's move!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu, this is no time to panic!  (He pulls ABU off his head and sees they are flying into a wall.) Start panicking.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Help me out! OLD MAN:    Throw me the lamp!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I can't hold on.  Give me your hand. OLD MAN:    First give me the lamp!  OLD MAN:    Ha ha ha ha!  Yes!  At last!  Ha ha ha ha!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: What are you doing? OLD MAN:    Giving you your reward.  (JAFAR returns to his normal voice.) Your eternal reward.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Heh heh heh! It's mine.  It's all mine! I (He can't find it in his pocket)--- where is it?  No. NO!!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jasmine?  Oh, dearest.  What's wrong?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Jafar...has...done something... terrible.  (She looks as if she's been crying.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: There, there, there, my child--we'll set it right. Now, tell me everything.

speaker: ABU
text: Oh, oh. Aladdin?  Wake up.  Aladdin.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, my head. (He looks at the entrance sealed in.) We're trapped.  (Angry, shaking his fists at the entrance) That two faced son-of-a-jackal!  (Calmer) Whoever he was, he's long gone with that lamp.

speaker: ABU
text: Aha!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Why, you hairy little thief!  Looks like such a beat-up, worthless piece of junk.  Hey, I think there's something written here, but it's hard to make out.

speaker: GENIE
text: Aaaaahhhhh!  OY!  Ten-thousand years will give ya such a crick in the neck!  (He hangs ALADDIN on a nearby rock.  Then he pulls his head off and spins it around, yelling as he does so.  CARPET pulls a ALADDIN down.)  Whoa!  Does it feel good to be outta there! (GENIE uses the lamp end of himself as a microphone.) Nice to be back, ladies and gentlemen.  Hi, where ya from? (Sticks the mic in ALADDIN's face.)  What's your name?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Uh, Al--uh--Aladdin.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Says his name as if he's discovered something major) Aladdin! (A neon sign lights up with ALADDIN's name on it, circled by chase lights.  The sign changes to reflect the GENIE's upcoming line.) Hello, Aladdin.  Nice to have you on the show.  Can we call you 'Al?' Or maybe just 'Din?'  Or how bout 'Laddi?'  (GENIE disappears, then a dog wrapped in plaid jumps in.) Sounds like 'Here, boy! C'mon, Laddi!'

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Shaking his head) I must have hit my head harder than I thought.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Still a dog) Do you smoke?  Mind if I do? (Dog poofs into smoke, then back to the GENIE.  ABU screeches wildly.)  Oh, sorry Cheetah--hope I didn't singe the fur!  Hey, Rugman!  Haven't seen you in a few millennia!  Slap me some tassel!  Yo! Yeah! (CARPET flies over and high fives the GENIE. GENIE looks at ALADDIN.)  Say, you're a lot smaller than my last master. (Lifts his beer-gut.)  Either that or I'm gettin' bigger.  Look at me from the side--do I look different to you?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Wait a minute!  I'm--your master?

speaker: GENIE
text: (Slaps a diploma in ALADDIN's hand and a mortarboard on his head.)  That's right!  He can be taught!! What would you wish of me, (as Arnold Schwarzenegger)  the ever impressive,(inside a cube) the long contained, (as a ventriloquist with a dummy) often imitated, (tosses the dummy aside) but never duplicated--  DUP. GENIES:    Duplicated, duplicated,  duplicated, duplicated,  duplicated,  duplicated, duplicated, duplicated, duplicated.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Says it like a ring announcer at a boxing match.) Genie!  Of!  The Lamp!  (Goes into Ed Sullivan)  Right here direct from the lamp, right here for your enjoyment wish fulfillment. Thank youuuuu!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Whoa!  Wish fulfillment?

speaker: GENIE
text: Three wishes to be exact.  And ix-nay on the wishing for more wishes.  (Turns into a slot machine, arm pulls down and three GENIEs appear in the windows.)  That's it--three.  (Three GENIE caballeros come out of the slot.)  Uno, dos, tres.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (To ABU) Now I know I'm dreaming.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Music for "Friend Like Me" begins) Master, I don't think you quite realize what you've got here! So why don't you just ruminate, whilst I illuminate the possibilities.  (GENIE lights up like a fluorescent light)  Well Ali Baba had them forty thieves Scheherazadie had a thousand tales But master you in luck 'cause up your sleeve You got a brand of magic never fails!

speaker: GENIE
text: So what'll it be, master?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: You're gonna grant me any three wishes I want?

speaker: GENIE
text: (As William F. Buckley) Ah, almost.  There are a few provisos, a couple of quid pro quos

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Like?

speaker: GENIE
text: Ah, rule number one: I can't kill anybody.  (He slices his head off with his finger.)  So don't ask.  Rule two: I can't make anyone fall in love with anyone else.  (Head turns into a big pair of lips which kiss ALADDIN.)  You little punim, there.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Looks at ABU as if plotting) Ah, provisos?  You mean limitations?  On wishes? (To ABU) Some all powerful genie--can't even bring people back from the dead. I don't know, Abu--he probably can't even get us out of this cave.  Looks like we're gonna have to find a way out of here--

speaker: GENIE
text: Excuse me?  Are you lookin' at me?  Did you rub my lamp? Did you wake me up, did you bring me here?  And all of a sudden, you're walkin' out on me?  (Gets madder and madder) I don't think so, not right now.  You're gettin' your wishes, so siddown!  (They all get on CARPET. GENIE takes the form of a stewardess, with lots of arms pointing out the exits.)  In case of emergency, the exits are here, here, here, here,here, here, here, here, here, here, here, here, anywhere!  Keep your hands and arms inside the carpet.  Weeee'rrrrrreee...outta here!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jafar, this is an outrage.  If it weren't for all your years of loyal service... . From now on, you are to discuss sentencing of prisoners with me, before they are beheaded.

speaker: JAFAR
text: I assure you, your highness, it won't happen again.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jasmine, Jafar, now let's put this whole messy business behind us.  Please?

speaker: JAFAR
text: My most abject and humblest apologies to you as well, princess.  (He takes her hand to kiss it, but she yanks it away.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: At least some good will come of my being forced to marry.  When I am queen, I will have the power to get rid of you.

speaker: SULTAN
text: That's nice.  All settled, then.  Now, Jasmine, getting back to this suitor business, (he looks and sees Jasmine walking out) Jasmine? Jasmine!  (He runs after her.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: If only I had gotten that lamp!

speaker: IAGO
text: (As JASMINE) I will have the power to get rid of you!  D'oh!  To think--we gotta keep kissing up to that chump, and his chump daughter for the rest of our lives...

speaker: JAFAR
text: No, Iago.  Only until she finds a chump husband. Then she'll have us banished--or beheaded!

speaker: BOTH
text: Eeewww!

speaker: IAGO
text: (Has an idea) Oh!  Wait a minute!  Wait a minute! Jafar?  What if you were the chump husband?

speaker: JAFAR
text: (He looks at IAGO in insult)  What?

speaker: IAGO
text: Okay, you marry the princess,all right? Then, uh, you become sultan!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Oh!Marry the shrew?  I become sultan.  The idea has merit!

speaker: IAGO
text: Yes, merit! Yes!  And then we drop papa-in-law and the little woman off a cliff!  (Dive bombs into the floor)  Kersplat!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Iago, I love the way your foul little mind works!

speaker: GENIE
text: (Still as stewardess) Thank you for choosing Magic Carpet for all your travel needs.  Don't stand until the rug has come to a complete stop.  (As ALADDIN and ABU get off down the stairway formed by CARPET) Thank you.  Good bye, good bye!  Thank you! Good bye!  (Back to normal)  Well, now.  How about that, Mr.  doubting mustafa?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, you sure showed me.  Now about my three wishes-

speaker: GENIE
text: Dost mine ears deceive me?  Three? You are down by ONE, boy!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Ah, no--I never actually wished to get out of the cave.  You did that on your own.

speaker: GENIE
text: Well, don't I feel just sheepish?  All right, you baaaaad boy,  but no more freebies.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Fair deal.  So, three wishes.  I want them to be good.  (To GENIE) What would you wish for?

speaker: GENIE
text: Me?  No one's ever asked me that before. Well, in my case, ah, forget it.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: What?  No, tell me.

speaker: GENIE
text: Freedom.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: You're a prisoner?

speaker: GENIE
text: It's all part-and-parcel, the whole genie gig.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, that's terrible.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Comes out of the LAMP) But, oh--to be free.  Not have to go "Poof! What do you need? Poof! What do you need? Poof! What do you need?"  To be my own master, such a thing would be greater than all the magic and all the treasures in all  the world! But what am I talking about, here?  Let's get real here.  It's not gonna happen.  Genie, wake up and smell the hummus

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Why not?

speaker: GENIE
text: The only way I get outta this is if my master wishes me out.  So you can guess how often that's happened.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'll do it. I'll set you free.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Head turns into Pinocchio's with a long nose) Uh huh, right.  Whoop!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No, really, I promise.  (He pushes the nose back in and GENIE's head returns to normal.) After make my first two wishes, I'll use my third wish to set you free.   (He holds out his hand)

speaker: GENIE
text: Well, here's hopin'.  (Shakes ALADDIN's hand.) O.K.   Let's make some magic!  (Turns into a magician.)  So how 'bout it.  What is it you want most?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, there's this girl--

speaker: GENIE
text: Eehhh! (Like a buzzer, and GENIE's chest shows a heart with a cross through it.)  Wrong!  I can't make anybody fall in love, remember?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, but Genie.  She's smart and fun and...

speaker: GENIE
text: Pretty?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Beautiful.  She's got these eyes that just...and this hair, wow...and her smile.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Sitting in a Parisian cafe with ABU and CARPET.) Ami.  C'est l'amour.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: But she's the princess.  To even have a chance, I'd have to be a--hey, can you make me a prince?

speaker: GENIE
text: Let's see here.  (Has a "Royal Cookbook".) Uh, chicken a'la king? (Pulls out a chicken with a crown on its head)  Nope.  Alaskan king crab?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I wish for you to make me a prince!

speaker: GENIE
text: All right!  Woof woof woof woof! (Takes on square shoulders and looks like Arsenio Hall. Then becomes a tailor/fashion designer.)  First, that fez and vest combo is much too third century. These patches--what are we trying to say--beggar?  No! Let's work with me here. (He takes ALADDIN's measurements, snaps his fingers and ALADDIN is outfitted in his prince costume.)  I like it, muy macho!  Now, still needs something.  What does it say to me?  It says mode of transportation.  Excuse me, monkey boy!  Aqui, over here!  (ABU tries to cover himself with CARPET, but GENIE zaps him and he flies over.)

speaker: ABU
text: Uh oh!

speaker: GENIE
text: Here he comes, (ALADDIN and GENIE are on a game show set, where ALADDIN stands behind a podium with "AL" on it.)  And what better way to make your grand entrance on the streets of Agrabah, than riding your very own brand new camel!  Watch out, it spits!  (A door bearing the GENIE's head on it opens, where ABU is transformed into a camel.  He spits out the side of his mouth on cue.  But the GENIE's not sure.)  Mmm, not enough.  (He snaps his fingers and ABU turns into a fancy white horse.) Still not enough.  Let's see.  What do you need?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu, you look good.

speaker: GENIE
text: He's got the outfit, he's got the elephant, but we're not through yet.  Hang on to your turban, kid, cause we're gonna make you a star!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Sire, I have found a solution to the problem with your daughter.

speaker: IAGO
text: Awk!  The problem with your daughter!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, really?

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Unrolling a scroll) Right here.  "If the princess has not chosen a husband by the appointed time, then the sultan shall choose for her."

speaker: SULTAN
text: But Jasmine hated all those suitors!  (He tries to stuff a cracker into IAGO's mouth.  IAGO backs away.  The SULTAN absentmindedly pulls the cracker back.)  How could I choose someone she hates?

speaker: JAFAR
text: Not to worry, my liege.  There is more.  If, in the event a suitable prince cannot be found, a princess must then be wed to...hmm...interesting.

speaker: SULTAN
text: What?  Who?

speaker: JAFAR
text: The royal vizier!  Why, that would be...me!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Why, I thought the law says that only a prince can marry a princess, I'm quite sure.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Desperate times call for desperate measures, my lord.  (He pulls out the staff and hypnotizes the SULTAN with it.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: Yes...desperate measures...

speaker: JAFAR
text: You will order the princess to marry me.

speaker: SULTAN
text: I...will order...the princess...to...(the spell breaks momentarily)...but you're so old!

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Holds the staff closer) The princess will marry me!

speaker: SULTAN
text: The princess will marry...(the spell is again broken, this time by the trumpet fanfare of "Prince Ali".)  What? What is that?  That music!  Ha ha ha. Jafar., you must come and see this!

speaker: MARCHERS
text: Make way for Prince Ali!

speaker: SWORDSMEN
text: Say hey!  It's Prince Ali!

speaker: MAJOR
text: Hey, clear the way in the old bazaar, Hey you, let us through, it's a bright new star, Now come, be the first on your block to meet his eye! Make way, here he comes, Ring bells, bang the drums. You're gonna love this guy  CHORUS OF MEN:(Carrying the camels) He's got seventy-five golden camels!

speaker: HARRY
text: Don't they look lovely, June?  CHORUS OF WOMEN:    (On a float)  Purple peacocks, he's got fifty-three!

speaker: JUNE
text: Fabulous, Harry, I love the feathers!

speaker: GENIE
text: (GENIE is off screen, a giant balloon gorilla proceeds down the parade) When it comes to exotic type mammals Has he got a zoo, I'm telling you It's a world class menagerie!

speaker: CHORUS
text: He's got ninety-five white Persian monkeys!

speaker: GENIE
text: Prince Ali! Amorous he!  Ali Ababwa Heard your princess was a sight lovely to see! And that,good people, is why He got dolled up and dropped by With sixty elephants, llamas galore With his bears and lions A brass band and more With his forty fakirs, his cooks, his bakers His birds that warble on key Make way for Prince Ali!

speaker: SULTAN
text: (Clapping) Splendid, absolutely marvelous.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Takes on a deeper voice.)  Ahem.  Your majesty, I have journeyed from afar to seek your daughter's hand.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Prince Ali Ababwa!  Of course.  I'm delighted to meet you.  (He rushes over and shakes ALI's hand.) This is my royal vizier, Jafar.  He's delighted too.

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Extremely dryly) Ecstatic.  I'm afraid, Prince Abooboo--

speaker: ALADDIN
text: --Ababwa!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Whatever.  You cannot just parade in here uninvited and expect to--

speaker: SULTAN
text: ...by Allah, this is quite a remarkable device.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Why certainly, your majesty.  Allow me.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Sire, I must advise against this--

speaker: SULTAN
text: --Oh, button up, Jafar.  Learn to have a little fun.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Just where did you say you were from?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, much farther than you've traveled, I'm sure.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Try me.  (IAGO lands on the staff.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: Look out, Polly!

speaker: IAGO
text: Hey, watch it. Watch it with the dumb rug!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Out of the way, I'm coming in to land.  Jafar, watch this!  (He lands.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Spectacular, your highness.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Ooh, lovely.  Yes, I do seem to have a knack for it.  (CARPET walks over to ABU dizzily, then collapses.  ABU catches it.)  This is a very impressive youth. And a prince as well.   (Whispers to JAFAR) If we're lucky, you won't have to marry Jasmine after all.

speaker: JAFAR
text: I don't trust him, sire.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Nonsense.  One thing I pride myself on Jafar, I'm an excellent judge of character.

speaker: IAGO
text: Oh, excellent judge, yeah, sure...not!!!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jasmine will like this one!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: And I'm pretty sure I'll like Princess Jasmine!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Your highness, no.  I must intercede on Jasmine's behalf.  (JASMINE hears this and gets mad.) This boy is no different than the others.  What makes him think he is worthy of the princess?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Your majesty, I am Prince Ali Ababwa! (He pricks JAFAR's goatee, which springs out in all directions.)  Just let her meet me.  I will win your daughter!

speaker: JASMINE
text: How dare you!  (They all look at her surprised.) All of you, standing around deciding my future?  I am not a prize to be won!  (She storms out.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, dear.  Don't worry, Prince Ali.  Just give Jasmine time to cool down.  (They exit.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: I think it's time to say good bye to Prince Abooboo.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: What am I going to do?  Jasmine won't even let me talk to her.  I should have known I couldn't pull off this stupid prince wish.  (ABU struggles with his elephant paws to open a banana.  He squishes it, and the banana squirts into his eye.  He then tosses the banana peel into a heaping pile of the same.)

speaker: GENIE
text: (to carpet, playing chess) So move!  (CARPET does, knocking a black piece off the board.)  Hey. That's a good move.  (As Rodney Dangerfield) I can't believe it--I'm losing to a rug.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I need help.

speaker: GENIE
text: (as Jack Nicholson) All right, sparky, here's the deal.  You wanna court the little lady, you gotta be a straight shooter, do ya follow me?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: What?

speaker: GENIE
text: (Back to normal, wearing a mortarboard. He points out his words on a blackboard)  Tell her the...TRUTH!!!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No way!  If Jasmine found out I was really some crummy street rat, she'd laugh at me. (He puts on his turban, which lights up as the GENIE.)

speaker: GENIE
text: A woman appreciates a man who can make her laugh!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey, that's the last thing I want to  be.  Okay, I'm gonna go see her.  I gotta be smooth, cool, confident.  How do I look?

speaker: GENIE
text: (Sadly) Like a prince.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (From a distance) Princess Jasmine?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Who's there?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: It's me--Prince Ali.  Ahem--(Then he jumps to his deep voice) Prince Ali Ababwa.

speaker: JASMINE
text: I do not want to see you.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No, no, please princess.  Give me a chance. (RAJAH growls and advances on him.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Just leave me alone.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Down kitty!

speaker: GENIE
text: How's our beau doing?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Good kitty, take off.  Down kitty. (He takes off his turban to brush RAJAH away.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She looks at him thinking she has seen him before.)  Wait, wait.  Do I know you?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Quickly replaces his turban) Uh, no, no.

speaker: JASMINE
text: You remind me of someone I met in  the marketplace.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: The marketplace?  (A bee buzzes around his head.) I have servants that go to the marketplace for me. Why I even have servants who go to the marketplace for my servants, so it couldn't have been me you met.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She looks disappointed.)  No, I guess not.

speaker: BEE
text: (It's the GENIE) Enough about you, Casanova.  Talk about her! She's smart,  fun, the hair, the eyes. Anything--pick a feature!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Um, Princess Jasmine?  You're very...

speaker: BEE
text: Wonderful, glorious, magnificent, punctual!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Punctual!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Punctual?

speaker: BEE
text: Sorry.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Beautiful.

speaker: BEE
text: Nice recovery.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Hmm.  I'm rich too, you know.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yeah!

speaker: JASMINE
text: The daughter of a sultan

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I know.

speaker: JASMINE
text: A fine prize for any  prince to marry.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Uh, right.  Right.  A prince like me.

speaker: BEE
text: (Buzzing in his ear) Warning! Warning!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Right, a prince like you.  And every other stuffed  shirt, swaggering, peacock I've met!

speaker: BEE
text: (Rear end on fire, wearing goggles and crashing) Mayday! Mayday!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Just go jump off a balcony! (She turns and walks away)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: What?

speaker: BEE
text: Stop her! Stop her! Do you want me to sting her?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Swats at bee) Buzz off!

speaker: BEE
text: Okay, fine.  But remember--bee yourself! (BEE buzzes into his turban)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yeah, right!

speaker: JASMINE
text: What!?!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Uh, you're right.  You aren't just some prize to be won.  (He looks disappointed.)  You should be free to make your own choice.  (JASMINE and RAJAH look at each other in confusion.)  I'll go now. (He steps up on the ledge and drops off.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: No!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Pokes his head up from over the edge) What?  What?

speaker: JASMINE
text: (Now she's amazed) How--how are you doing that?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: It's a magic carpet.

speaker: JASMINE
text: It's lovely.  (CARPET takes JASMINE's hand with a tassel.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: You, uh, you don't want to go for a ride, do you? We could get out of the palace, see the world.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Is it safe?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Sure.  Do you trust me?

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She looks at him at the saying of that all- important line) What?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Extends his hand the same as before) Do you trust me?

speaker: JASMINE
text: (Gets a sly grin on her face) Yes.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I can show you the world Shining, shimmering, splendid. Tell me princess, now when did you last Let your heart decide?

speaker: JASMINE
text: A whole new world A dazzling place I never knew But when I'm way up here It's crystal clear That now I'm in a whole new world with you!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Now I'm in a whole new world with you!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Unbelievable sights Indescribable feeling Soaring, tumbling, freewheeling Through an endless diamond sky

speaker: JASMINE
text: A whole new world!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Don't you dare close your eyes

speaker: JASMINE
text: An hundred thousand things to see

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hold your breath--it gets better!

speaker: JASMINE
text: I'm like a shooting star, I've come so far I can't go back to where I used to be!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: A whole new world!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Every turn a surprise

speaker: ALADDIN
text: With new horizons to pursue

speaker: JASMINE
text: Every moment, red-letter

speaker: BOTH
text: I'll chase them anywhere There's time to spare Let me share this whole new world with you  A whole new world That's where we'll be

speaker: ALADDIN
text: A thrilling chase

speaker: JASMINE
text: A wondrous place

speaker: BOTH
text: For you and me!

speaker: JASMINE
text: It's all so magical.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yeah.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She looks at him and decides to burst the bubble) It's a shame Abu had to miss this.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Nah.  He hates fireworks.  (CARPET looks up realizing what is happening.)  He doesn't really like flying either. (And now ALADDIN realizes it) That is...oh no!

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She pulls off his turban) You are the boy from the market!  I knew it.  Why did you lie to me?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine, I'm sorry.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Did you think I was stupid?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No!

speaker: JASMINE
text: That I wouldn't figure it out?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No.  I mean, I hoped you wouldn't.  No, that's not what I meant.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Who are you?  Tell me the truth!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: The truth? (He looks at CARPET who wave him on, giving up hope.)  The truth...the truth is...I sometimes dress as a commoner to escape the pressures of palace life.  (CARPET slumps down in defeat.)  But I really am a prince! (The feather on his turban falls down over his eyes.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: Why didn't you just tell me?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, you know, um...royalty going out into the city in disguise, it sounds a little strange, don't you think?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Not that strange.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Good night, my handsome prince.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Sleep well, princess.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Yes!  (He falls back onto the CARPET, who descends to the ground.) For the first time in my life, things are starting to go right.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey!  What?  (A gag is tied around his mouth. Muffled words) Abu!  Abu!  (We see the elephant hanging from a net tied in a tree.)

speaker: GUARD
text: Hold him!

speaker: JAFAR
text: I'm afraid you've worn out your welcome, Prince Abooboo.  (Walks away.)  Make sure he's never found.

speaker: GENIE
text: Never fails.  Get in the bath and there's a rub at the lamp.  (Squeaks the duck)  Hello.  (Sees unconscious ALADDIN) Al?  Al!  Kid, snap out of it! You can't cheat on this one!  I can't help you unless you make a wish.  You have to say  "Genie I want you to save my life."  Got it?  Okay.  C'mon Aladdin!!  (He grabs ALADDIN by the shoulders and shakes him.  His head goes up, then falls.)  I'll take that as a yes.  (Head turns into a siren.) Wooga!  Wooga!  (Turns into a submarine.)  Up scope!  (He babbles in something that sounds like German.  On the surface, a giant water spout emerges, and lands on top of the cliff.  ALADDIN reawakes and coughs the water out of his lungs.) Don't you scare me like that!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I--uh, I-uh...(He can't think of how to say it, so they just hug each other.)  Thanks, Genie.

speaker: GENIE
text: Oh, Al.  I'm gettin' kind of fond of you, kid.  Not that I want to pick out curtains or anything.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jasmine!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, father--I just had the most wonderful time. I'm so happy.

speaker: SULTAN
text: (Still monotone from the hypnosis) You should be, Jasmine. I have chosen a husband for you.

speaker: JASMINE
text: What?

speaker: SULTAN
text: (The other door opens and reveals JAFAR.)  You will wed Jafar.

speaker: JAFAR
text: You're speechless, I see.  A fine quality in a wife.

speaker: JASMINE
text: I will never marry you.  (She goes to the SULTAN) Father, I choose Prince Ali!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Prince Ali left!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Better check your crystal ball  again, Jafar!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Prince Ali!

speaker: IAGO
text: How in the he--(back to parrot-ese)--uh, awk!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Tell them the truth, Jafar!  You tried to have me killed.

speaker: JAFAR
text: What?  (He goes to the SULTAN)  Ridiculous nonsense, your highness.  He is obviously lying.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Obviously...lying.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Father, what's wrong with you?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I know!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Oh, oh, oh my!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Your highness, Jafar's been controlling you with this!  (He advances the staff)

speaker: SULTAN
text: What?  Jafar?  You, you traitor!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Your majesty, all of this can be explained.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Guards! Guards!

speaker: IAGO
text: Well, that's it--we're dead, forget about it.  Just dig a grave for both of us.  We're dead.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Arrest Jafar at once.

speaker: JAFAR
text: This is not done yet, boy!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Find him, search everywhere!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine, are you all right?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Yes.

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jafar, my most trusted counselor, plotting against me all this time.  Just horrible.  How will I ever-

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Sultan?

speaker: SULTAN
text: Yes, a fine upstanding youth like yourself, a person of your unimpeachable moral character is exactly what this kingdom needs!  (ALADDIN looks concerned at this.)

speaker: IAGO
text: We gotta get outta here!  We gotta get--  I gotta start packing, your highness.  Only essentials.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Prince Ali is nothing more than that ragged urchin Aladdin.  He has the lamp, Iago.

speaker: IAGO
text: Why that miserable--

speaker: JAFAR
text: But you are going to relieve him of it!

speaker: IAGO
text: Me?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Sultan?  They want me to be sultan?

speaker: GENIE
text: Huzzah!  Hail the conquering hero!  (Turns into a one-man band.  He sees ALADDIN walk away with his head hung.  He stops, scratches his head, comes up with an idea, then zooms over to ALADDIN.  He holds up his hands like a director scoping a picture and we look through them.)  Aladdin, you've just won the heart of the princess.  What are you gonna do next?  (ALADDIN looks at him, then walks away in sadness to the bed, where he falls on it and sighs. GENIE again is confused, then goes to him and pulls out a script labeled "Aladdin." Whispering: ) Psst, your line is "I'm going to free the genie." Anytime.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie...I can't.

speaker: GENIE
text: Sure you can.  You just go "Genie, I wish you free."  (He grabs ALADDIN's head and uses him as a mock ventriloquist's dummy.  ALADDIN pulls away.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'm serious.  Look, I'm sorry--I really am. But they want to make me sultan--no!, They want to make Prince Ali sultan.  Without you, I'm just Aladdin.

speaker: GENIE
text: Al, you won!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Because of you!  The only reason anyone thinks I'm anything is because of you.  What if they find out I'm not really a prince?  (Quietly)  What if Jasmine finds out?  I'll lose her.  Genie, I can't keep this up on my own.  I can't wish you free.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Sarcastically) Hey, I understand.  After all, you've lied to everyone else.  Hey, I was beginning to feel left out.  Now, if you'll excuse me, master. (He says the last word in disgust, then poofs back into the lamp.)

speaker: ABU
text: Ohhh.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I'm really sorry. (A tongue comes out of the spout and raspberries him.)   Well, fine. (He slams a pillow on top of the LAMP.)  Then just stay in there!  (He looks at ABU and CARPET.)  What are you guys looking at? (They both leave.) Look, I--I'm sorry.  Wait, Abu-- wait--I'm sorry, I didn't-- wait, c'mon.  (He sighs.)  What am I doing? Genie's right--I gotta tell Jasmine the truth.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (From a distance)  Ali, oh Ali--will you come here?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Putting on his turban) Well, here goes.  (He walks into the garden.)  Jasmine?  Where are you?

speaker: IAGO
text: Ahem--In the menagerie, hurry.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I'm coming.

speaker: FLAMINGO
text: D'uh!

speaker: IAGO
text: Ya got a problem, pinky?  (He sweeps the bird's feet out from under it. IAGO runs into the palace and finds the lamp under the pillow.)  Boy, Jafar's gonna be happy to see you!  (Stretches his face like JAFAR's and imitates it.)  Good work, Iago!

speaker: SULTAN
text: People of Agrabah, My daughter has finally chosen a suitor!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine?

speaker: JASMINE
text: Ali, where have you been?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: There's something I've got to tell you.

speaker: JASMINE
text: The whole kingdom has turned out for father's announcement!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: No! But Jasmine, listen to me, please!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Good luck!  (She pushes him out onto the platform with the SULTAN, where he overlooks the entire crowd.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: ...Ali Ababwa!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, boy!

speaker: IAGO
text: Look at them, cheering that little pipsqueak.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Let them cheer.

speaker: GENIE
text: You know Al, I'm getting (turns and sees JAFAR) reallyyyyyy--I don't think you're him.  (He descends and consults a playbill.)  Tonight, the role of Al will be played by a tall, dark and sinister ugly man.

speaker: JAFAR
text: I am your master now.  (He throws GENIE to the ground and puts his foot on GENIE's face.)

speaker: GENIE
text: I was afraid of that.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Genie, grant me my first wish.  I wish to rule on high, as sultan!!!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Whoa!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Bless my soul.  What is this?  What is going on?

speaker: JAFAR
text: Heh heh heh!

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jafar, you vile betrayer.

speaker: IAGO
text: That's Sultan Vile Betrayer to you.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Oh, yeah?  Well, we'll just see about that!  (Pulls off his own turban, but finds it empty)  The lamp!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Finders-keepers, Abooboo.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie!  No!

speaker: GENIE
text: Sorry, kid--I got a new master now.  (He places the palace on top of a mountain.)

speaker: SULTAN
text: Jafar, I order you to stop!

speaker: JAFAR
text: There's a new order now--my order!  Finally, you will bow to me!

speaker: JAFAR
text: We'll never bow to you!

speaker: IAGO
text: Why am I not surprised?

speaker: JAFAR
text: If you will not bow before a sultan, then you will cower before a sorcerer!  (To GENIE)  Genie, my second wish--I wish to be the most powerful sorcerer in the world!

speaker: IAGO
text: Ladies and gentlemen, a warm Agrabah welcome for Sorcerer Jafar!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Now where were we?  Ah, yes--abject humiliation!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (off-camera) Jafar!  Get your hands off her!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Prince Ali Yes, it is he, But not as you know him. Read my lips and come to grips With reality

speaker: IAGO
text: Or should we say Aladdin?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine, I tried to tell you.

speaker: JAFAR
text: So Ali turns out to be merely Aladdin Just a con, need I go on? Take it from me His personality flaws Give me adequate cause To send him packing on a one-way trip So his prospects take a terminal dip His assets frozen, the venue chosen Is the ends of the earth, whoopee! So long,

speaker: IAGO
text: Good bye, see ya!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Ex-Prince Ali!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu?  Abu!  (He looks back at a shivering pile of snow.)  Oh, this is all my fault--I should have freed the genie when I had the chance.  (He digs out ABU and cradles him inside his vest.)  Abu! Are you okay?  I'm sorry, Abu--I made a mess of everything, somehow.  I gotta go back and set things right.  (He starts to walk through the snow, and he eventuallysteps on a frozen CARPET.) Carpet!  (He looks up and sees CARPET is pinned by the pillar.  He tugs to try and free CARPET.  He can't do it, so he begins to remove snow from the base of the pillar.)   Abu, start digging!  That's it!  (Finally, enough snow has been removed, and the pillar begins to roll.  ALADDIN runs away, looks back, then slides into place.  The pillar rolls over him, and when it is gone, ALADDIN and ABU are left sitting in the patch of snow made by the window of the pillar.)  Yeah!  All right!  (He looks up at his turban, made out of scared ABU. CARPET shakes off the snow and rushes over to pick them up.)  Now, back to Agrabah!  Let's go!

speaker: IAGO
text: Puppet ruler want a cracker? Here's your cracker. Shove 'em all right down your throat.  Here, have lots!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Leave him alone!

speaker: JAFAR
text: It pains me to see you reduced to this, Jasmine.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Never!

speaker: JAFAR
text: I'll teach you some respect! (She falls back as he raises his hand to slap her.  Then he stops.)  No. Genie, I have decided to make my final wish.  I wish for Princess Jasmine to fall desperately in love with me.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Again as Buckley) Ah, master-- there are a few addendas, some quid pro quo-

speaker: JAFAR
text: Don't talk back to me, you stupid blue lout!  You will do what I order you to do, slave!

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She stands and puts the crown on her head.) Jafar!  I never realized how incredibly handsome you are.

speaker: JAFAR
text: That's better.  (He pulls the GENIE's jaw up like a shade.)  Now, pussycat, tell me more about...myself.

speaker: JASMINE
text: You're tall, well dressed...

speaker: GENIE
text: Al!  Al, little buddy!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Shh!

speaker: GENIE
text: (Literally zips his mouth shut, then unzips it.) Al, I can't help you--I work for senor psychopath, now.  (His head turns into JAFAR's, then back.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hey--I'm a street rat, remember? (He rezips GENIE's mouth.)  I'll improvise.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Go on.

speaker: JASMINE
text: And your beard...is so...twisted!  (She has her arms around him.  She pretends to twist with her finger, but she is actually motioning for ALADDIN to come over.  He makes his move.  IAGO sees him.)

speaker: IAGO
text: Jaf--mmmmmm! (ABU grabs him and covers his mouth.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: And the street rat?

speaker: JASMINE
text: What street rat?

speaker: ABU
text: Yuck!

speaker: JAFAR
text: That was--(he sees ALADDIN's reflection in her crown.) You!!  How many times do I have to kill you, boy?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Get the lamp!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Ah, ah, ah, princess--Your time is up!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine!

speaker: IAGO
text: Oh, nice shot, Jaf-- (he is knocked out by ABU.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Don't toy with me!  (He's zapped into a toy monkey.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Abu!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Things are unraveling fast, now boy. (CARPET is zapped and unravels.  ALADDIN again rushes for the lamp.)  Get the point?  (His path is blocked by large swords sticking in the floor.  JAFAR grabs the lamp and laughs hideously. ALADDIN pulls a sword out of the floor.) I'm just getting warmed up!  (He breathes a ring of fire around ALADDIN.)

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Are you afraid to fight me yourself, you cowardly snake?

speaker: JAFAR
text: A snake, am I?  Perhaps you'd like to see how snake-like I can be!  (He smiles broadly, and we see a snake's tongue come out from behind his teeth.  He then turns into a giant cobra, and the ring of fire around ALADDIN becomes part of the snake encircling ALADDIN.  The snake JAFAR makes moves on ALADDIN, and on the third try, ALADDIN swings the sword and hits JAFAR.  Cut to GENIE cheerleaders wearing 'A' sweaters.)

speaker: GENIE
text: Rickem, rockem, rackem, rake--stick that sword into that snake!

speaker: JAFAR
text: You stay out of thissss!

speaker: GENIE
text: (Weakly) Jafar, Jafar, he's our man--if he can't do it, GREAT!

speaker: JASMINE
text: Aladdin!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Hang on, Jasmine!

speaker: JAFAR
text: (laughs hideously)  You little fool!  You thought you could defeat the most powerful being on earth!

speaker: IAGO
text: (with GENIE coming up behind him) Squeeze him, Jafar--Squeeze him like a--awk! (GENIE elbows him out of the way)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Without the genie, boy, you're nothing!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (Has an idea)  The genie!  The genie!  The genie has more power than you'll ever have!

speaker: JAFAR
text: What!!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: He gave you your power, he can take it away!

speaker: GENIE
text: Al, what are you doing?  Why are you bringing me into this?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Face it, Jafar--you're still just second best!

speaker: JAFAR
text: You're right!  His power does exceed my own!  But not for long!

speaker: GENIE
text: The boy is crazy.  He's a little punch drunk.  One too many hits with the snake  (His hand turns into a snake and he hits his head with it.)

speaker: JAFAR
text: Slave, I make my third wish!  I wish to be an all powerful genie!

speaker: GENIE
text: (Reluctantly) All right, your wish is my command. Way to go, Al.

speaker: JAFAR
text: Yes!  Yes!  The power! The absolute power!

speaker: JASMINE
text: (to ALADDIN) What have you done?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Trust me!

speaker: JAFAR
text: The universe is mine to command, to control!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Not so fast, Jafar!  Aren't you forgetting something?

speaker: JAFAR
text: No!  No!

speaker: IAGO
text: I'm gettin' out of here!  Come on, you're the genie, I don't want--

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Phenomenal cosmic powers!  Itty bitty living space.

speaker: GENIE
text: Al, you little genius, you!

speaker: JAFAR
text: (Both from inside the lamp.)  Get your blasted beak out of my face!

speaker: IAGO
text: Oh, shut up, you moron!

speaker: JAFAR
text: Don't tell me to shut up!

speaker: GENIE
text: Allow me.  (He takes the lamp and goes to the balcony.  He is now wearing a baseball cap.  He winds up as if to throw the lamp, but opens his palm flat and flicks it out into the desert with his finger.) Ten- thousand years in a cave of wonders ought to chill him out!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine, I'm sorry I lied to you about being a prince.

speaker: JASMINE
text: I know why you did.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Well, I guess...this... is goodbye?  (GENIE pokes his head around the corner shocked at what he is hearing.)

speaker: JASMINE
text: Oh, that stupid law.  This isn't fair--I love you.

speaker: GENIE
text: (Wipes away a tear)  Al, no problem. You've still got one wish left.  Just say the word and you're a prince again.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: But Genie, what about your freedom?

speaker: GENIE
text: Hey, it's only an eternity of servitude.  This is love.  (He leans down next to her.)  Al, you're not gonna find another girl like her in a million years.  Believe me, I know.  I've looked.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Jasmine, I do love you, but I've got to stop pretending to be something I'm not.

speaker: JASMINE
text: I understand.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I wish for your freedom.

speaker: GENIE
text: One bona fide prince pedigree coming up.  I--what?

speaker: ALADDIN
text: (He holds the lamp up to GENIE.)  Genie, you're free!

speaker: GENIE
text: (He can't believe it.)  Heh, heh!  I'm free. I'm free.  (He hands the lamp to ALADDIN.)  Quick, quick, wish for something outrageous.  Say  "I want the Nile."   Wish for the Nile.  Try that!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: I wish for the Nile.

speaker: GENIE
text: No way!!  (Laughs hysterically.  He bounces around the balcony like a pinball.)  Oh does that feel good!  I'm free!  I'm free at last!  I'm hittin' the road.  I'm off to see the world!  I--

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Genie, I'm--I'm gonna miss you.

speaker: GENIE
text: Me too, Al.  No matter what anybody says, you'll always be a prince to me.

speaker: SULTAN
text: That's right.  You've certainly proven your worth as far as I'm concerned. It's that law that's the problem.

speaker: JASMINE
text: Father?

speaker: SULTAN
text: Well, am I sultan or am I sultan?  From this day forth, the princess shall marry whomever she deems worthy.

speaker: JASMINE
text: (She smiles widely and runs into ALADDIN's arms.) Him!  I choose...I choose you, Aladdin.

speaker: ALADDIN
text: Ha, ha.  Call me Al.

speaker: GENIE
text: Oh, all of ya. Come over here.  Big group hug! Mind if I kiss the monkey?  (He kisses ABU.)  Ooh, hairball!  Well, I can't do any more damage around this popsicle stand.  I'm outta here!  Bye, bye, you two crazy lovebirds.  Hey, Rugman: ciao!  I'm history!   No, I'm mythology!  No, I don't care what I am--I'm free!

speaker: ALADDIN
text: A whole new world

speaker: JASMINE
text: A whole new life

speaker: BOTH
text: (with off-camera chorus)    For you and me! MEN'S CHORUS:   A whole new world!

speaker: GENIE
text: Made ya look!
